text: Is the css combining an opt in item  or is it for all beta testers?
I believe its for everyone except chad
three people on my team changed their name because of it

Can we get the ability to see the HTML code of the rich text editor in HubDB just like on any regular page? I pasted content in and assumed everything was correct until I viewed the page and realized there were <p> tags where they didn't look like they should have been.
Put up an issue to get this resolved
And youâ€™d be ok with the fact that the raw HTML is read-only?
All I was asking for is the Source Code view that we have in a normal rich text editor. Let me attach an image.
Guess I can't in the thread. Sorry.

IE: If I'm editing a site page that has a rich text box, I have access to a button to view source code for the content in that rich text box. But in HubDB I don't have this same button in the rich text box.
This is the same issue myself and others have mentioned. We want the same view/edit source button functionality as the normal rich text editors found elsewhere in HubSpot have.
This new rich text field design is also used in the new form editing pages - please give us that functionality there as well.
I'm not able to see a/b test data on my ctas in our portal..really odd
<@U25PYL3Q8> uploaded a file: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/files/U25PYL3Q8/F86SV7EUV/pasted_image_at_2017_11_28_04_04_pm.png|when I click edit template>
it just wants me to explore new tools, which doesn't guide you through anything. They also don't load the template I just tried to load #beta
